page.title: 09SANDBANKS TOLL FERRY
page.content: Studland Ferry runs from{Sandbanks} to{Shellbay},which is about 500m .Its 75p for cars and 25p for one person. .The ferry holds about 30 cars.It is powered by a Diesel-Electric motor which drives two winches to pull the ferry back and forth along two iron chains. It takes about 10 minutes to get across. The trouble ferries mainly have is when the chains break and they drift away!.(This last happened in 1984.) If cars go too fast and it's wet they may skid off the edge.Parking 28 cars 4-abreast close together leads to a few dents, especially when drivers forget the handbrake and the sea is rough.The worst problem in the summer is the queue on the Studland side which may reach over a mile in length and mean a delay of two hours and more before the journey home can really begin.
